text: November 20, 2009: Weekly Washington Update
label: HH1

text: November 20, 2009
label: BODY

text: We live in a land where brave men and women volunteer to go in harm's way to protect and
label: BODY

text: defend this nation. Some give all and all give some for the preservation of the freedoms and
label: BODY

text: liberties we hold sacred. The families of our servicemen and women also sacrifice in giving up
label: BODY

text: the time they would normally have together when their loved ones are overseas defending
label: BODY

text: freedom. Let us all take time to give thanks to our men and women in uniform and their families
label: BODY

text: for the gift of service and sacrifice they give to this nation.
label: BODY

text: While we live in a land of plenty there are unfortunately many folks that go to bed hungry each
label: BODY

text: night. In these difficult times there are more folks than ever who need our help in finding shelter
label: BODY

text: and food. Let us show our thanks by committing to help others in the year to come. Food banks
label: BODY

text: are short of the food they need to meet the needs of folks that come seeking their help. Shelters
label: BODY

text: do not have the room to accommodate all of those looking for a roof over their heads in their
label: BODY

text: time of need. Our communities do a fantastic job in trying to meet the needs of others but they
label: BODY

text: will fall short if we fail to rally for their call for help.
label: BODY

text: There are countless volunteers in our communities who run fire and rescue calls to help those in
label: BODY

text: their time of greatest need. These fine men and women also put themselves in harms way and
label: BODY

text: give of themselves 24 hours a day and 7 days to week to help. Let us give thanks for their
label: BODY

text: contributions to making our communities better and safer places to live, work and play.
label: BODY

text: We can make Thanksgiving a time of year to be truly thankful. When you talk with your friends,
label: BODY

text: families and neighbors let them know why you are thankful and how they can do the same to
label: BODY

text: others. Tell everyone you know that we are blessed in so many ways by the gifts given to us by
label: BODY

text: others and how they lift us up in many ways that we may never realize. Whether it is those who
label: BODY

text: serve this nation in uniform, those who help others in need, those who protect us and answer
label: BODY

text: our calls for help we should always be thankful and express our thanks in our words and
label: BODY

text: actions. Happy Thanksgiving!
label: BODY

text: Congressman Rob Wittman represents the First District of Virginia. He was elected to his first
label: BODY

text: full term in November 2008 and serves on the Natural Resources Committee and the Armed
label: BODY

text: Services Committee where he is the Ranking Member of the Oversight and Investigations
label: BODY

text: Subcommittee.
label: BODY
